flow.descriptionCdata:
b41cb092-9255-4b9c-9298-82c4b7b2153b.2e49d4bc-eefa-4090-a50e-2306256e9e3f.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
b41cb092-9255-4b9c-9298-82c4b7b2153b.2f34993b-c9aa-4493-9ae0-17d2afb66ce5.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
b41cb092-9255-4b9c-9298-82c4b7b2153b.3b2b1185-e5ea-4c94-b206-5724182123ce.description=
Operation to check for null or empty string local variables.

Inputs\:

inputList\:  comma seperated list of variables to check

Reponsses\:
hasNull\:  at least one variable is null or has an empy string for a value
noNulls\:  all variables have a value

Result\:  List of variables that are null or empty strings
b41cb092-9255-4b9c-9298-82c4b7b2153b.4a6df78d-d239-4bc5-a3b1-924e576b0e9d.description=
Removes a file/folder

Input Parameters\:
source - full path to file or directory

Responses\:
success - file/directory removed successfully
failure - unable to remove file/directory
b41cb092-9255-4b9c-9298-82c4b7b2153b.66371d4a-19ae-4ac0-b59e-f56dfbc34bcd.description=
Writes the data from "contents" input to the requested file. The operation can be used to overwrite existing content of the file,  append extra lines to it or even create a new file.

Input Parameters\:
source           -  Full path to file. If the file does not exist it is created first.
contents        - The contents to write to the file. Contents can have a new line delimiter which is also given as input to the operation, but it is optional. Example\: "This is line no. 01\nThis is line no. 2\n" where \n is the delimiter.
delimiter         - Specifies the newline delimiter (\n, \r\n, etc) that is used for the "contents" input.
characterSet  - The character encoding used to write to the file. The default is UTF-8. Example values\: windows-1252, UTF-16, UTF-16BE,  ISO-8859-1, US-ASCII, Shift_JIS etc.
overwrite       - Specifies whether to overwrite the file or append to it. By default, the used value is true. Accepted values\: true, false or the empty string. If this is left empty, the file will be overwritten.

Responses\:
success - file/directory is written successfully
failure   - unable to write to file/directory
b41cb092-9255-4b9c-9298-82c4b7b2153b.929379cc-d156-4fee-88f9-cbdc492cdd78.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
b41cb092-9255-4b9c-9298-82c4b7b2153b.a9faad11-f039-4fd3-80f7-5bdb40b26159.description=
Removes a file/folder

Input Parameters\:
source - full path to file or directory

Responses\:
success - file/directory removed successfully
failure - unable to remove file/directory
b41cb092-9255-4b9c-9298-82c4b7b2153b.bd646160-c347-45e0-b3a5-8ab2c5f8f0c3.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

b41cb092-9255-4b9c-9298-82c4b7b2153b.dcea798c-1bb1-4f0c-8f99-0a4993f965c7.description=
Performs a XSL Transformation on a RAS to transform a XML document.  Runtime parameters can be specified with the paramKey and paramValue inputs.

Input Parameters\:
templateLocation - The location of the XSL stylesheet to use.  Can be a local file path or an http url.
xmlLocation - The location of the XML document to transform.  Can be a local file path or an http url.  This is optional because some stylesheets do not need a XML document and can create output based on runtime parameters.
outputFile - The local file to write the output of the transformation.  If an output file is not specified the output of the transformation will returned as returnResult.
paramKey - A list of parameter names delimited by paramDelimiter.
paramValue - A list of parameter values delimited by paramDelimiter.
paramDelimiter - List delimiter for paramKey and paramValue inputs (default is comma).

Responses\:
success - The XSL transformation succeeded.
failure - The XSL transformation failed.  See returnResult for failure reasons.

Results\:
returnResult - The output of the transformation if no output file is specified.

Notes\:
Specifying parameters\:
If more then one parameter needs to be specified for a transformation, populate paramKey with a list of parameter names and paramValue with the respective parameter values.  As an example here is a simple stylesheet that has parameters firstName, lastName and color (it does not transform an xml document)\:



OO
User
\#000000






Hello  \!



		




By default (with no parameters specified) this will create a html document that says\: "Hello OO User\!" in black text.  When you apply the following paramKey and paramValue inputs\:

paramKey\=firstName,lastName,color
paramValue\=Valued,Customer,blue
paramDelimiter\=,

The output with these parameters would create a html document that says\: "Hello Valued Customer\!" in blue text.
b41cb092-9255-4b9c-9298-82c4b7b2153b.description=
This is a wrapper for the built-in HPOO XSLT operation which requires file manipulation in order to perform the XSL Transformation.  This generic subflow takes in the input xml data and xsl template, writes each to a file, then performs a XSL Transformation on a RAS using the supplied HPOO XSLT operator.  Runtime parameters can be specified with the paramKey and paramValue inputs.

Required Input Parameters\:
xsltFile - The filename to write the XSL stylesheet.
xmlFile - The filename to write the XML document to transform.
xmlInput - the XML content to be transformed
xslTransform - The XSLT stylesheet defining the transformation

Optional Input Parameters\:
filePath - The location to write the temporary files for the transfomration.  Default\: (use the ${hosteng_ucras_filepath} system property)
outputFile - The filename to write the output of the transformation.  If an output file is not specified the output of the transformation will returned as the variable xsltResult.
paramKey - A list of parameter names delimited by paramDelimiter.
paramValue - A list of parameter values delimited by paramDelimiter.
paramDelimiter - List delimiter for paramKey and paramValue inputs (default is comma).

Responses\:
success - The XSL transformation succeeded.
failure - The XSL transformation failed.  See returnResult for failure reasons.

Results\:
xsltResult - The output of the transformation if no output file is specified.
errorDetails - If the file write operations or the XSLT operation fails, the an error message will be set and the flow will exit with a failure response
warnDetails - If the file delete operations fail, a warning message will be set and the flow will continue to exit with a success response

Notes\:
Specifying parameters\:
If more then one parameter needs to be specified for a transformation, populate paramKey with a list of parameter names and paramValue with the respective parameter values.  As an example here is a simple stylesheet that has parameters firstName, lastName and color (it does not transform an xml document)\:



OO
User
\#000000






Hello  \!



		




By default (with no parameters specified) this will create a html document that says\: "Hello OO User\!" in black text.  When you apply the following paramKey and paramValue inputs\:

paramKey\=firstName,lastName,color
paramValue\=Valued,Customer,blue
paramDelimiter\=,

The output with these parameters would create a html document that says\: "Hello Valued Customer\!" in blue text.

b41cb092-9255-4b9c-9298-82c4b7b2153b.ec91ece3-15f0-49b5-9d04-f611f671faf9.description=
Writes the data from "contents" input to the requested file. The operation can be used to overwrite existing content of the file,  append extra lines to it or even create a new file.

Input Parameters\:
source           -  Full path to file. If the file does not exist it is created first.
contents        - The contents to write to the file. Contents can have a new line delimiter which is also given as input to the operation, but it is optional. Example\: "This is line no. 01\nThis is line no. 2\n" where \n is the delimiter.
delimiter         - Specifies the newline delimiter (\n, \r\n, etc) that is used for the "contents" input.
characterSet  - The character encoding used to write to the file. The default is UTF-8. Example values\: windows-1252, UTF-16, UTF-16BE,  ISO-8859-1, US-ASCII, Shift_JIS etc.
overwrite       - Specifies whether to overwrite the file or append to it. By default, the used value is true. Accepted values\: true, false or the empty string. If this is left empty, the file will be overwritten.

Responses\:
success - file/directory is written successfully
failure   - unable to write to file/directory

flow.name: hpooXslt

staticBinding.value: hpooXslt: Failed to write xslt transform to the file, (${filePath}/${xsltFile}).
hpooXslt: Failed to perform XSLT transform.
hpooXslt: Failed to delete xslt template file, (${filePath}/${xsltFile}).
hpooXslt: Failed to write xml data to the file, (${filePath}/${xmlFile}).
hpooXslt: Failed to delete xml data file, (${filePath}/${xmlFile}).
